DOC.detailed_description: This study begin Preparatory Phase , wherein eligible participant receive 25 session Exposure Ritual Prevention ( EX/RP ) therapy . At end Preparatory Phase , achieve wellness ( mild minimal symptom ) enter Study Phase . Those achieve wellness continue study refer treatment elsewhere . Those enter Study Phase assign chance one two group . One group continue SRI medication group discontinue SRI gradually 4-6 week replace placebo ( sugar pill ) . Neither patient study staff know group participant . Both group continue receive monthly session EX/RP . The study examine best response treatment study , include take blood sample genetic test see whether gene predict benefit EX/RP .
DOC.criteria: Preparatory Phase Primary diagnosis OCD Currently stable adequate dose serotonin reuptake inhibitor ( i.e. , clomipramine , fluoxetine , fluvoxamine , sertraline , paroxetine , citalopram , escitalopram ) still clinically significant OCD symptom Comorbid Psychiatric condition significantly elevate risk study participation ( e.g . psychotic disorder , bipolar disorder , evidence dementia cognitive disorder , suicidality ) Unstable medical condition need attention would make participation study unsafe ( e.g. , high blood pressure ) Patients already prior adjunctive EX/RP ( 8 session within 2 month ) receive adequate SRI trial Patients take medication besides SRI ( e.g . antipsychotic , mood stabilizer , antidepressant besides SRIs ) Patients pregnant , sexually active use contraception , nursing Study Phase Those achieve mild minimum OCD symptom Preparatory Phase enter Study Phase All exclusion list Preparatory Phase exclusion Study Phase well Patients depressed end Preparatory phase exclude Study Phase
